Package mainPackage

Class Round

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainPackage.Round
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorkingRound

    public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
implements WorkingRound
    Defines how the game will progress. This is the real core of the game, where a player will be allowed to play, where the next player will be defined, ...
    Author:
    Benjamin Héroult

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Round​(boolean direction, Game game)
      Instantiation of the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void endGame​()
      Informs the user that the game is finished.
      void endPlayer​()
      Informs the user that the current player posed it's last card.
      Player getCurrentPlayer​()
      Gives an access to who is the current player.
      int getPlayerPosition​()
      Gives an access to position of the actual player
      void initPlayerRound​()
      Informs the user of the beginning of the game.
      void nextPlayer​()
      Defines who will be the next player, by using the direction of the game and the actual player.
      Player nextPlayer​(int playerPos, Player currentPlayer)
      Second version of the method, used by other classes such as in a case of effects, to have an access to some functions from the next player
      void setDirection​()
      Changes the direction of the game
      void startPlaying​(Game game)
      Call the method to roll out the game only if it has not been called already.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Round

        public Round​(boolean direction,
             Game game)
        Instantiation of the class. Defines some attributes to start a game.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction that takes the game. An analogy with a table can be useful to see how it works.
        game - transmission of game's instantiation to use some of it's functions

    • Method Detail

      • nextPlayer

        public Player nextPlayer​(int playerPos,
                         Player currentPlayer)
        Second version of the method, used by other classes such as in a case of effects, to have an access to some functions from the next player
        Parameters:
        playerPos - position of the player used as reference to move across the list
        currentPlayer - name of the current player
        Returns:
        the next player

      • nextPlayer

        public void nextPlayer​()
        Defines who will be the next player, by using the direction of the game and the actual player.

      • startPlaying

        public void startPlaying​(Game game)
        Call the method to roll out the game only if it has not been called already. The action is kept in memory with the attribute start. Plays the same roll as a singleton for a class.
        Parameters:
        game - to access give access game's content to playing method
